children.name: Investment
children.description: In 2022, Gross Fixed Capital Formation was 18.3% of GDP, up from 17.7% a year earlier and 18.2% 5 years ago. This is lower than France (25%) and Germany (22%).

children.name: Government
children.description: In Q3 2023, central government investment was Â£16.5B. The UK government invests a lower proportion of GDP (17.7%) than France (24.4%) or Germany (21.3%).

children.name: Corporate
children.description: British business investment equals around 10% of GDP, lower than France (14%) and Germany (12%).

children.name: Research and Development
children.description: R&D spending in the UK in 2021 was 2.9% of GDP, higher than the OECD average of 2.7%. NB: Investigate ONS-OECD difference

children.name: Finance
children.description: The Bank of England base rate is 5.25, up 1.25pp in the last year and at its highest level since May 2008.

children.name: Human Capital
children.description: In Q4 2023, 21.9% of 16-64 year olds were economically innactive, up slightly on one year prior (21.7%). The UK has a higher rate of economic inactivity than Germany (20.2%) but lower than France (26.1%).
